description: This is a market on whether the number of Americans that file weekly jobless claims will exceed 310,000 for the week ending on Saturday, September 11, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were more than 310,000 seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on September 11, 2021. This market will resolve to “No” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were 310,000 or fewer seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on September 11, 2021.  The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Unemployment Insurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, September 11, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, September 16, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. If data is not available for the aforementioned dates by Wednesday, September 22, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

markets.question: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 310K for the week ending on September 11?

title: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 310K for the week ending on September 11?
